name: clubby
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Clubby people or places are friendly to those who belong there, but unfriendly to those who do not. : He had been part of the city's clubby group of high-ranking bureaucrats. We are all aware of how clubby the House of Commons is.
More examplesFewer examplesTheir conversations frequently descended into a kind of clubby, cocktail party small talk.I didn't have any time for their clubby, cliquey attitudes.They found that boardrooms are clubby, and that diversity is often seen as a hindrance, when it should be a strength.
